name: Grand Mercure Roxy Singapore

reviews.title: Geschäftsreise...
reviews.text: The hotel was very nice and everything was wonderfull! I will book my next journey also in this hotel! Everything was great!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I were looking for a good base to attend the Formula One Singapore Grand Prix in September 2009. The other requirements were a swimming pool and easy to access the city.
reviews.title: Extremely well located 4 star Singapore hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to stay away from the craziness of the City Centre and opted to spend 8 nights at the Grand Mercure Roxy.
reviews.title: ideal for overnight stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much to our surprise, the hotel is only 3 bus stops away from Suntec City (route 36 uses the freeway) and no more than 15 minutes max to City Hall MRT station. There is a 36 bus every 10 minutes or so. A cab ride from the hotel to the city costs about S$10 if you decide to travel after midnight.
reviews.title: Spacious room, near the airport (free airport shuttle) but no MRT nearby & not near the city

reviews.text: The big plus is the location. The Roxy is a couple of blocks away from the East Coast Park and the beach. Ideal for relaxing day or night. You'll find joggers, cyclists, roller bladers and swimmers using the park at all times of the day/night. It is also possible to rent bikes and roller blades for S$4 per hour.
reviews.title: Surrounded by great food

reviews.text: We had three nights at the Grand Mercure Roxy in October 2007. We arrived to hear that we'd been upgraded to a Junior Suite, woohoo!
reviews.title: Nice Very Reasonably Priced Hotel, a bit out of the way

reviews.text: Lovely, friendly service, nice 4* hotel with very spacious rooms.
reviews.title: Perhaps a second attempt in *never*

reviews.text: My few complaints (which in no way spoiled our holiday in Singapore) are as follows:
reviews.title: Convenient to airport, ghastly food

likes.liked: — Cleanliness; the Good Hope massage establishment next door
likes.disliked: — Inconvenient location and ghastly, overpriced food

reviews.title: Nice stay, except for one bad experience
reviews.text: 1. Biggest downside with the Roxy Grand Mercure is that it is NOWHERE NEAR ANYTHING of any interest. It's got a big shopping plaza next door but other than that, it is a 15 minute cab ride from the city and equivalent amount to anything else of interest.
2. The room service is overpriced and the food was probably the worst we had during our three week holiday. Maybe we were just unlucky on that front.
reviews.title: Disappointed: poor houskeeping and upkeep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was not expecting to write a not so flattering review of this hotel but unfortunately we didn't have the most memorable experience. Realise that there are always lemons(that room that is left until last) in most hotels so was our turn to experience the lemon, shame that this happens but hotels should realise that these days that anyone staying could be doing a review so should look after their clients accordingly.
reviews.title: Not so Happy
great hotel, not in city, but great shopping and food across the street!!convenient!! free airport shuttle too!!
reviews.text: We did appreciate the free hotel shuttle bus but felt that the hotel was much further from the airport than we expected. Our check-in was okay but had difficulty understanding our young check-in lady - she was telling us our room was through the exit but would be quiet. Well we were tired from travelling that day so just said okay. Just as well the bell boy found us trying to find our room, it was indeed through the exit, one would never know there was a room on the other side of an exit door, it certainly didn't make one feel very excited, made me feel quite locked in and claustrophobic.

The room was just okay, felt water splash on me as I opened my suitcase and looked up to see drops of water forming on the air-conditioning vents, had to put plastic over our luggage to stop the drops falling on it. Actually the air-conditioning was the noisiest we had ever encountered in any stay, so much so that even with ear plugs I finally got up in the night and turned the thing off as I felt like we were not getting any sleep at all.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Had a shower before heading off to bed and could not believe that such shocking thin towels, almost threadbare were supplied. Even the products were at a minimum so
reviews.title: Deserves a second chance!

reviews.text: I felt just so disappointed with this hotel and this certainly wasn't a budget sale booking where one could understand them not giving you the best of rooms.
reviews.title: Bugs Bugs Bugs

reviews.text: A great alternative for a short stopover in Singapore. As the Transit Hotels were full I tried the Grand Mercure Roxy for the first time. It is a 20 minute free shuttle ride from Changi airport with pickups every 30 minutes. With a 10 hour stopover the Roxy was a good choice. A good value 4 star hotel in a very non tourist part of Singapore. The rooms had been recently remodelled and were more than comfortable. Within 100 yards of the hotel were shopping centres - great for that last minute gifts as well as an array of restaurants all heavily patronised by local Singaporeans. I have visted Singapore many times but this was the first time I had stayed away from the downtown harbour/Orchard Road strip. It was well worth it for a different perspective on this city.
reviews.title: Singapore Stopover
Could do with a re-furbishment
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel enroute to Europe for 2 nights. The Roxy has a free airport shuttle which was convenient after arriving from SYD late, with ski luggage.

We are 2 adults and 2 children so I booked adjoining rooms. My only complaint is that the rooms are VERY tired. Both our rooms had frayed carpet, holes in the bed linen and mouldy bathroom tiles - disgusting!
reviews.title: Horrible Experince Please Please save your money and time its just not worth it

likes.disliked: — The service, The rooms, we stayed in the deluxe room btw

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is just OK but nothing special, although convenient with kids. The food court over the road was amazing for choice and price - AUD$3 for a meal.
reviews.title: Good hotel, not so great location

reviews.text: Location is a bit out of the way for 2 nights, but all would have been acceptable had the rooms been in better shape.
reviews.title: Relaxing holiday away from the hustle & bustle of Orchard Rd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used it for a one night stop over. All the staff I met were excellent, made the stay very easy and comfortable, breakfast was fine, didnt get a chance to use the pool but it looked inviting at 9pm floodlit etc. Good location for restaurants and shops, 15 min from terminal. Room was fine, lovely big bathroom and rain shower perfect after a 12 hour flight
reviews.title: does what it says on the tin

reviews.text: This is definitely a good hotel for stopover. Rooms are spacious and clean but business centre is extremely expensive. There is a free internet corner but you need a password to access.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location and Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's quite a distance from Orchard but there are heaps of taxis and buses to take you downtown. Across the hotel is the Park Way Parade with over 5 levels of shops, one of which is a huge supermarket, Giant. There are also lots of hawkers food stall along the way. Unfortunately, I didn't have enough time to explore the vicinity.
reviews.title: Great hotel, poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel shuttle is very efficient and punctual and you have to book a day before as it on a first come first serve basis. Their coffee shop is nice and cosy and its a great place to have a quick catch up with friends. Their cakes are offered at 50% off after 10.00pm so it's great for supper.
reviews.title: Relaxing hotel with spacious clean rooms and great pol & fitness facilities

reviews.text: I will definitely come back to stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable & convenient

reviews.text: This would be a great option if you had to stay overnight in Singapore on a stopover - closer to the airport than the city areas, close to the water for seafood or right near a heap of old bars, restaurants etc plus modern shops. The money you save on the hotel will be made up by catching taxis to places. Definitely not within walking distance of Bugis, Clarke Quay etc. The coffee shop is super expensive - avoid! Concierge was very helpful. Great size room.
reviews.title: Nor very happy
Ideal for the East Coast
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Roxy numerous times over the past 10 years, and it never disappoints. It is convenient for business at Changi and Loyang and for leisure offers easy access to the Beach and Restaurants of East Coast Park on one side and the ethnic history of Katong on the other. The rooms are large and well appointed and the public areas well maintained. I haven't used the restaurants much as there is so much choice nearby but can vouch for the ambience and friendly atmosphere of the poolside bar. Well worth considering if you have business on the East Coast yet downtown and the river are only a few minutes taxi ride away.

reviews.title: Good Quality
reviews.text: The room is very big and the bed one of the best I've experienced in a hotel. Room Service is very early, knocking around 9.15 (I forgot to put the "do not disturb" sign out). Location is not central but extremely close to the airport and public transport (bus) brings you right to the esplanade. Too bad breakfast costs extra, but since there is big shopping center just across the street one gets a chance to eat with the locals

reviews.title: About the menu breakfast
reviews.text: The menu must change everyday, don`t just one menu have change. But the hotel is good to stay , good price and the good service too. I will come back again to this hotel.

It was my 2nd time staying at the hotel,.1st time was in a studio suite, access to the club floor on top floor was great. Service on the club floor was good + the stunning view of the sea & the HDB blocks. But some rude staff at the pool lounge that refuse to serve us drinks was rather disappointing. The hotel manage did give us a call to apologies after we left.
reviews.title: A Dark X'mas Eve

reviews.text: I needed a hotel to stopover at after I'd landed around midnight, and the airport transit hotels were full. This was the cheapest option available, and they have a free airport shuttle every half hour, so it's quite OK for an overnight stay if you don't want to spend a lot more for the Crowne Plaza Hotel at the airport.
reviews.title: Decent Stopover Hotel

reviews.text: Decent sized rooms with free internet and comfortable beds. Bathroom a little dated but functional. A little away from the action and there didn't seem to be much around the hotel, and it's a long way from the nearest MRT, so it's really not a good location if you're there for business or sight-seeing.
reviews.title: Good place for stopover only...could be better and friendlier

reviews.text: That said, the staff were efficient if not overly polite, and the shuttle service to the airport is pretty convenient.
reviews.title: Worth the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel twice, each for business and quite a long stay...the room is big, always full, the breakfast is so so, the cappuccino machine certainly give big upgrade.
reviews.title: Nice, clean room, good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Too bad they don't have the free wi-fi, its a bit annoying to queue on the two internet computer in lobby.
reviews.title: Does the job - what more do you want?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in late December as a stoppover for 1 night. This hotel can be very good value. We ot a very good deal on the Accor site - $129S which is excellent value. The rooms are a good size, starting to show some age but the room we had was clean and had all of the facilities expected of a four star hotel. The pool area though small is very pleasant for a refreshing dip. It is located a short walk to the East Coast Park seafood and eating centres ( 10 m - 15 mins tops) A mall is directly opposite with two local food courts very close by with food at very good qulaity at rediculous prices. It is also a short wlak to Joo Chiat Road. There are heaps of very good value retsauarants within a 10 min walk. We quite like staying in the East Coats Park Area, it is less hectic and a very nice morning stroll or jog. TThere is also heaps to od if you have teenagers with you in the East Coats area. Only hassle is the MRT station is not really close - they have a shuttle to it of a morning and a shuttle to the airport.
reviews.title: Good Value - interesting location?
Good
reviews.text: Recommended as astopover or as an alternative to city hotels.
is all good there-average room amenities.Average cleanliness inside the room.
reviews.title: Well worth paying for....as long as you don't pay too much !
Continues to disappoint
reviews.text: On arrival room wasn't ready and had to wait about four hou

reviews.title: Hotel away from CBD
reviews.text: rs from 10:00am

reviews.title: good
reviews.text: Our stay in Mercure Roxy Hotel was very good had a pleasant stay.

reviews.title: Area to improve
reviews.text: Thanks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a weekend staycation at this hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday. We drove there and parked at the shopping mall carpark instead of the hotel's. Walked through the old-fashioned shopping mall before reaching the grand lobby of the hotel. Luckily things took up from there.
reviews.title: Slightly Dated but Overall Still Good!

reviews.text: Checked into our deluxe room and was impressed by it! Yes, the hotel is a bit dated, bath tub seems a bit worn out, but our stay was comfortable. Bonuses for our stay includes the close proximity to East Coast Park, Parkway Parade Shopping Centre and also the delicious and cheap local food and Marine Parade Food Centre.
reviews.title: Long way out and unhelpful staff
convience
reviews.text: The hotel also went all the way out to send us a small slice of birthday cake which was a surprise!

aka: Grand Mercure Roxy Singapore Hotel Singapore
description: The Grand Mercure Roxy is an ideal hotel for a business trip or holiday in Singapore. A haven from the bustling city amidst the heritage charms of historic Katong, the hotel enjoys easy access to the city centre, Singapore Expo, the Suntec Convention Centre and Orchard Road. Enjoy fantastic shopping at the nearby Parkway Parade or a great day out at East Coast Park with beaches, recreational facilities and renowned seafood restaurants. 15 minutes from Changi Airport with complimentary shuttle service.
